storyTitle: As Approver, I want to review schedule change requests to achieve informed decision-making

testCases.title: Verify approver can view and act on pending schedule change requests
preconditions: User account with approver role exists in the system
At least one pending schedule change request is assigned to the approver
Request contains complete details and at least one attachment
System is accessible and all services are running
Database contains valid test data in ScheduleChangeRequests table

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page and enter valid approver credentials
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the home page

steps.action: Click on 'Pending Approvals' menu item or navigate to the pending approvals dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Pending approvals dashboard loads within 3 seconds and displays all assigned pending requests with request ID, requester name, request date, and status

steps.action: Select a specific pending schedule change request from the list by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens showing complete information including requester details, requested changes, reason, submission date, and all attached documents

steps.action: Click on attachment links to verify accessibility
steps.expectedResult: Attachments open or download successfully without errors

steps.action: Click the 'Approve' button to initiate approval action
steps.expectedResult: Comment dialog box appears prompting for optional comments

steps.action: Enter comment 'Approved as requested - meets all policy requirements' in the comment field
steps.expectedResult: Comment text is accepted and displayed in the input field

steps.action: Click 'Submit' or 'Confirm' button to finalize the approval
steps.expectedResult: Success message is displayed confirming approval action, request status updates to 'Approved', action is logged in ApprovalActions table with timestamp and approver details, and request is removed from pending list

postconditions: Request status is updated to 'Approved' in the database
Approval action is logged with timestamp, approver ID, and comments in ApprovalActions table
Request no longer appears in the approver's pending list
Audit trail is complete and traceable
Requester can view the updated status

testCases.title: Ensure unauthorized users cannot approve requests
preconditions: User account without approver role exists in the system
At least one pending schedule change request exists
Role-based access control is configured and active
API endpoints are protected with authorization checks

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page and enter credentials for a user without approver role (e.g., regular employee)
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the home page

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to 'Pending Approvals' dashboard via URL or menu
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with error message 'You do not have permission to access this page' or 'Pending Approvals' menu item is not visible

steps.action: Attempt to directly access a specific approval request URL if known
steps.expectedResult: System redirects to error page or displays 'Access Denied' message with HTTP 403 status

steps.action: Using API testing tool (e.g., Postman), attempt to call GET /api/approvals/pending with non-approver user token
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden status with error message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Using API testing tool, attempt to call POST /api/approvals/decisions with non-approver user token and valid request payload
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden or 401 Unauthorized status with authorization error message, and no changes are made to the request status

postconditions: No approval actions are recorded in the system
Request status remains unchanged
Security violation attempt is logged in audit trail
No unauthorized access is granted to approval functionality

testCases.title: Validate rejection and request for additional information flows
preconditions: User account with approver role exists and is logged in
At least two pending schedule change requests are assigned to the approver
System is accessible and all services are running
Database is in consistent state

steps.action: From the pending approvals dashboard, select the first pending schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens displaying complete request information including all fields and attachments

steps.action: Click the 'Reject' button to initiate rejection action
steps.expectedResult: Comment dialog box appears with mandatory comment field indicated

steps.action: Enter rejection comment 'Request does not comply with company policy section 4.2 - insufficient justification provided'
steps.expectedResult: Comment text is accepted and displayed in the input field

steps.action: Click 'Submit' or 'Confirm' button to finalize the rejection
steps.expectedResult: Success message is displayed, request status updates to 'Rejected', rejection action is logged in ApprovalActions table with timestamp, approver ID, and comments, and request is removed from pending list

steps.action: Navigate back to pending approvals dashboard and select a second pending request
steps.expectedResult: Second request details page opens displaying complete information

steps.action: Click the 'Request Additional Information' button
steps.expectedResult: Comment dialog box appears prompting for details about what additional information is needed

steps.action: Enter comment 'Please provide supporting documentation from your manager and clarify the business justification for the schedule change'
steps.expectedResult: Comment text is accepted and displayed in the input field

steps.action: Click 'Submit' or 'Confirm' button to send the request for additional information
steps.expectedResult: Success message is displayed, request status updates to 'Additional Information Required' or 'Pending Requester', action is logged in ApprovalActions table with timestamp, approver ID, and comments, and request is removed from approver's pending list

steps.action: Verify the audit trail by accessing request history for both requests
steps.expectedResult: Complete history is displayed showing all actions with timestamps, approver names, status changes, and comments for both rejected and information-requested actions

postconditions: First request status is 'Rejected' with rejection comments logged
Second request status is 'Additional Information Required' with comments logged
Both actions are recorded in ApprovalActions table with complete audit information
Requesters can view updated statuses and comments
Both requests are removed from approver's pending list
Audit trail shows 100% completeness for all actions

storyTitle: As System Administrator, I want to configure approval workflow rules to achieve flexible and compliant routing

testCases.title: Validate creation and activation of approval workflow rules
preconditions: User account with system administrator role exists in the system
Admin console is accessible
At least two approver users exist in the system with assigned roles
WorkflowConfig tables are accessible and in consistent state
No conflicting workflow rules exist for the test scenario

steps.action: Navigate to the admin console login page and enter valid system administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Administrator is successfully authenticated and redirected to the admin console home page

steps.action: Click on 'Approval Workflow Configuration' menu item or navigate to workflow configuration section
steps.expectedResult: Workflow configuration UI is displayed showing existing workflows and a 'Create New Workflow' button

steps.action: Click 'Create New Workflow' or 'Add Workflow Rule' button
steps.expectedResult: Workflow creation form is displayed with fields for workflow name, description, conditions, and approver assignment

steps.action: Enter workflow name 'Schedule Change - Manager Approval', description 'Requires manager approval for schedule changes up to 5 days'
steps.expectedResult: Workflow name and description are accepted and displayed in the form fields

steps.action: Configure condition: Set 'Request Type' equals 'Schedule Change' AND 'Duration' less than or equal to '5 days'
steps.expectedResult: Conditional rules are added and displayed in the conditions section with proper logical operators

steps.action: In the approver section, select 'Direct Manager' as Level 1 approver from the dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Direct Manager is assigned as Level 1 approver and displayed in the workflow chain

steps.action: Click 'Validate' button to check workflow configuration
steps.expectedResult: System validates the workflow and displays success message 'Workflow configuration is valid - no errors detected'

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to save the workflow rule
steps.expectedResult: Workflow rule is saved to WorkflowConfig table, success message is displayed, and workflow appears in the list with 'Inactive' status

steps.action: Select the newly created workflow from the list and click 'Activate' button
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog appears asking to confirm activation

steps.action: Click 'Confirm' to activate the workflow
steps.expectedResult: Workflow status changes to 'Active', success message confirms activation, and workflow becomes effective immediately

steps.action: Create a test schedule change request matching the workflow conditions (schedule change for 3 days)
steps.expectedResult: Request is automatically routed to Direct Manager for approval based on the newly activated workflow rule, confirming the rule is applied to new requests

postconditions: New workflow rule is saved in WorkflowConfig table with active status
Workflow configuration is validated without errors
Workflow is active and applies to new matching requests
Changes propagate within 1 minute
Audit log records workflow creation and activation with administrator details and timestamps

testCases.title: Ensure validation prevents circular routing in workflow rules
preconditions: User account with system administrator role is logged into admin console
Workflow configuration UI is accessible
At least three approver roles exist in the system (e.g., Manager, Director, VP)
Validation rules for circular dependency detection are active

steps.action: Navigate to 'Approval Workflow Configuration' section in admin console
steps.expectedResult: Workflow configuration UI is displayed with option to create new workflow

steps.action: Click 'Create New Workflow' button to start creating a new workflow rule
steps.expectedResult: Workflow creation form is displayed with all configuration fields

steps.action: Enter workflow name 'Circular Test Workflow' and description 'Testing circular routing validation'
steps.expectedResult: Workflow name and description are accepted

steps.action: Configure multi-level approval chain: Set Level 1 approver as 'Manager', Level 2 as 'Director', Level 3 as 'VP'
steps.expectedResult: Three-level approval chain is configured and displayed

steps.action: Attempt to add Level 4 approver and select 'Manager' (same as Level 1), creating a circular reference
steps.expectedResult: Approver is added to the configuration temporarily

steps.action: Click 'Validate' or 'Save' button to validate the workflow configuration
steps.expectedResult: System detects circular routing and displays validation error message 'Error: Circular routing detected - Manager appears multiple times in the approval chain' or similar, preventing save operation

steps.action: Attempt to configure escalation rule where escalation routes back to a previous level approver
steps.expectedResult: Configuration is temporarily accepted in the UI

steps.action: Click 'Validate' or 'Save' button
steps.expectedResult: System detects circular escalation path and displays validation error 'Error: Circular escalation detected - escalation path creates an infinite loop', preventing save operation

steps.action: Verify that the workflow is not saved by checking the workflow list
steps.expectedResult: Invalid workflow does not appear in the saved workflows list, confirming save was prevented

postconditions: No workflow with circular routing is saved to the database
Validation error messages are clearly displayed to the administrator
WorkflowConfig table remains in consistent state without invalid rules
System integrity is maintained
Error is logged in system logs for audit purposes

testCases.title: Verify access restriction to workflow configuration
preconditions: User account without administrator role exists (e.g., regular employee or approver role only)
Workflow configuration section exists and is protected by role-based access control
Admin console is accessible
Security policies are properly configured

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page and enter credentials for a non-administrator user (e.g., regular employee)
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to appropriate home page based on their role

steps.action: Attempt to access admin console by clicking admin menu or navigating to admin URL
steps.expectedResult: Admin console menu is not visible or access is denied with error message 'Access Denied: Administrator privileges required'

steps.action: Attempt to directly navigate to workflow configuration URL (e.g., /admin/workflow-config) by typing in browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: System redirects to error page or displays 'Access Denied' message with HTTP 403 Forbidden status, preventing access to workflow configuration

steps.action: Using API testing tool (e.g., Postman), attempt to call GET /api/workflow-config with non-admin user authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden status with error message 'Insufficient permissions - Administrator role required'

steps.action: Using API testing tool, attempt to call POST /api/workflow-config with non-admin user token and valid workflow configuration payload
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden or 401 Unauthorized status with appropriate error message, and no workflow configuration changes are made to the database

steps.action: Verify audit logs for unauthorized access attempts
steps.expectedResult: All unauthorized access attempts are logged in security audit trail with user ID, timestamp, attempted action, and denial reason

postconditions: No workflow configuration changes are made by non-admin user
WorkflowConfig table remains unchanged
All unauthorized access attempts are logged in security audit trail
System security is maintained
User receives clear error messages indicating lack of permissions
